questions.question: Are you ……………………. aware of the consequences of your action?
questions.description: Here the adverb fully modifies the adjective aware.

questions.question: The children performed really ……………………..
questions.description: Good is an adjective well is an adverb. Use the adverb well to modify the verb performed.

questions.question: I was ………………………… impressed with her performance.
questions.description: Here the adverb really modifies the verb impressed.

questions.question: You ………………………… ate anything.
A fast car goes ………………………….
questions.description: Fast can be adjective or adverb.

questions.question: She works ……………………….. to make a living.
questions.description: Hardly is similar to scarcely.

questions.question: The girl who answered the phone was very …………………………
questions.description: We use adjectives as subject complements.

questions.question: She looks …………………………… attractive.
questions.description: Here the adverb incredibly modifies the adjective attractive.

questions.question: He should be here …………………………...
The girl looked …………………………
questions.description: Look is a copular verb copular verbs are modified by adjectives.

questions.question: ………………………….. the lights went out.
If I listen to ……………………….. music, I get a headache.
questions.description: Here the adjective loud modifies the noun music.

questions.question: He runs ………………………..
questions.description: Fast can be an adjective and an adverb. There is no need for the word fastly.

questions.question: I can speak English ………………………….. than French.
questions.description: We need a comparative expression before than.

questions.question: The pretty girl smiled …………………………. at the guests.
questions.description: Here we use the adverb warmly to modify the verb smiled.

questions.question: She looked ………………………….. than ever before.
questions.description: Happier is the comparative form of happy.

questions.question: Can you write more …………………………?
questions.description: Legible is an adjective. We need the adverb legibly to modify the verb write.

questions.question: Her performance was the ………………………. of all.
questions.description: Worst is the superlative form of bad.

questions.question: They handled the situation quite ………………………..
questions.description: We need the adverb sensibly to modify the verb handled. More cannot be used with quite.

questions.question: I have ………………………….. interest in politics.
questions.description: Little is the positive form of the adjective.

questions.question: I earn …………………………. money than my mother.
questions.description: We use less with uncountable nouns and few with plural nouns.

questions.question: This essay has …………………………. mistakes than the other.
questions.description: We use less with uncountable nouns and few/fewer with plural nouns.

questions.question: She works ……………………….. than her husband.
He works …………………………… to support his family.
questions.description: Hard can be an adjective and an adverb. Hardly is similar to scarcely.

questions.question: He works hard to support his family. Here hard is an ...........................
questions.description: It modifies the verb works.

questions.question: She said that hard work is the secret of her success. Here hard is an .....................................
questions.description: It modifies the noun work.

questions.question: I want to buy a fast car. Here fast is an .........................................
questions.description: It modifies the noun car.

questions.question: My new car goes fast. Here fast is an ..................................
questions.description: It modifies the verb goes.

questions.question: He is pretty smart. Here pretty is an ......................................
questions.description: Here pretty is an adverb because it modifies the adjective smart.

questions.question: He is old enough to make his own bed now. Here enough is an ......................................
questions.description: It modifies the adjective old.

questions.question: Hold tight. I am going to pull you up. Here tight is an .......................................
questions.description: It modifies the verb hold.

questions.question: She did well in the test. Here well is an ......................................
questions.description: Well modifies the verb did. Adverbs modify verbs.

questions.question: My blouse is tight. Here tight is an .................................
questions.description: Only adjectives and nouns can be the complement of be.

questions.question: Please don't drive so fast. Here so is an ...........................................
questions.description: So is an adverb because it modifies the adjective fast.

questions.question: He speaks Russian quite well. Here quite is an ........................................
The show was rather amusing. Here rather is an ...........................................
The ship is still afloat. Here afloat is an ……………………
questions.description: Here the word afloat says something about the noun ship. Hence it is an adjective.

questions.question: She is the best mother in the world. Here best is an …………………………
questions.description: Here the word best modifies the noun mother.

questions.question: She danced happily into the room. Here happily is an …………………………
questions.description: Happily is an adverb. It modifies the verb danced.

questions.question: We bought the cheapest clothes in the shop. Here cheapest is an …………………………..
questions.description: Here cheapest modifies the noun clothes.

questions.question: I don’t remember him very well. Here very is an ………………………
questions.description: Here the adverb very modifies the adverb well. Only an adverb can modify another adverb.

questions.question: She smiled in a friendly way. Here friendly is an ……………………………
questions.description: Here friendly modifies the noun way. Only adjectives can modify nouns.

questions.question: Her singing was lovely. Here lovely is an …………………………..
questions.description: Here the adjective lovely modifies the noun singing. Not all words ending in –ly are adverbs.

questions.question: Sorry I didn’t post the letter – I clean forgot. Here clean is an ………………………….
questions.description: Here clean modifies the verb forgot.

questions.question: He was dead drunk when he got home. Here dead is an ……………………….
questions.description: Here dead is an adverb because it modifies the adjective drunk. Only adverbs can modify adjectives.

questions.question: The plane goes direct from Chicago to Atlanta without stopping. Here direct is an …………………………
questions.description: Here direct is an adverb because it modifies the verb goes.

questions.question: They sometimes must be bored. Here sometimes is an ………………………..
When did you last see your father? Here last is an ………………………….
questions.description: Words indicating time are adverbs.
